title: Elon Musk reacts to claims that Brazil blocked Starlink accounts: 'Lapdog, outright criminal'
content: Elon Musk criticized Brazil's President Lula and Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes after Brazil reportedly froze Starlink's bank accounts over fines against X, formerly Twitter. The court has given Musk 24 hours to designate a legal representative for X in Brazil, risking a potential ban. Musk accuses Moraes of censoring conservative voices.
summary: Elon Musk criticized Brazil's President Lula and Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes after Brazil reportedly froze Starlink's bank accounts over fines against X, formerly Twitter. The court has given Musk 24 hours to designate a legal representative for X in Brazil, risking a potential ban. Musk accuses Moraes of censoring conservative voices.

title: Over 1,000 dead, hundreds blinded in Bangladesh protests against Sheikh Hasina: Interim government
content: The protests against Sheikh Hasina's government have resulted in over 1,000 deaths, as reported by the interim administration led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus. Health adviser Nurjahan Begum disclosed the extent of injuries among civilians and police, including significant vision losses. The interim government is committed to holding fair elections after implementing essential reforms.
summary: The protests against Sheikh Hasina's government have resulted in over 1,000 deaths, as reported by the interim administration led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus. Health adviser Nurjahan Begum disclosed the extent of injuries among civilians and police, including significant vision losses. The interim government is committed to holding fair elections after implementing essential reforms.

title: Couple's romance in car go wrong as SUV submerges in Philadelphia river
content: In Philadelphia, a couple's SUV rolled into the Schuylkill River during an intimate moment when the woman kicked the gear shift by mistake. The incident took place early in the morning around 4:45 am. The couple managed to escape without injuries, and the police retrieved their vehicle a few hours later, with no charges filed.
summary: In Philadelphia, a couple's SUV rolled into the Schuylkill River during an intimate moment when the woman kicked the gear shift by mistake. The incident took place early in the morning around 4:45 am. The couple managed to escape without injuries, and the police retrieved their vehicle a few hours later, with no charges filed.

title: 'Know someone with lavish life, no job?': South Yorkshire police's post viral as people report Royal Family
content: South Yorkshire Police’s appeal on social media to identify individuals enjoying a luxurious lifestyle without any apparent jobs received an unexpected reaction. Many users humorously reported the Royal Family and high-profile figures including former PM Boris Johnson, present PM Keir Starmer. The appeal was part of an effort to combat economic crime in the region, the post said.
summary: South Yorkshire Police’s appeal on social media to identify individuals enjoying a luxurious lifestyle without any apparent jobs received an unexpected reaction. Many users humorously reported the Royal Family and high-profile figures including former PM Boris Johnson, present PM Keir Starmer. The appeal was part of an effort to combat economic crime in the region, the post said.

title: At least 9 dead in massive listeria outbreak linked to Boar’s Head deli meats
content: Federal health officials have reported nine deaths and 57 illnesses due to listeria infections linked to Boar’s Head deli meats. The outbreak, traced to a Virginia plant’s liverwurst, prompted a recall of over 7 million pounds of products distributed nationwide and internationally. In Virginia, 88-year-old Gunter “Garshon” Morgenstein died on July 18 from a brain infection caused by listeria linked to the contaminated Boar’s Head products
summary: Federal health officials have reported nine deaths and 57 illnesses due to listeria infections linked to Boar’s Head deli meats. The outbreak, traced to a Virginia plant’s liverwurst, prompted a recall of over 7 million pounds of products distributed nationwide and internationally. In Virginia, 88-year-old Gunter “Garshon” Morgenstein died on July 18 from a brain infection caused by listeria linked to the contaminated Boar’s Head products

title: Islamic Jihad commander killed in gunbattle at West Bank mosque, claims Israel
content: Israeli troops killed Muhammad Jabber, a commander of the Islamic Jihad movement, and four militants near a mosque in Tulkarm. This major military operation involved hundreds of troops, helicopters, and drones, leading to 17 Palestinian deaths over two days. Violence has intensified during the nearly 11-month-long Gaza conflict.
summary: Israeli troops killed Muhammad Jabber, a commander of the Islamic Jihad movement, and four militants near a mosque in Tulkarm. This major military operation involved hundreds of troops, helicopters, and drones, leading to 17 Palestinian deaths over two days. Violence has intensified during the nearly 11-month-long Gaza conflict.

title: Iran has further increased its stockpile of uranium enriched to near weapons-grade levels, UN says
content: The UN's nuclear watchdog reports that Iran has increased its stockpile of uranium enriched to near weapons-grade levels, now at 164.7 kilograms up to 60%. Tehran banned experienced nuclear inspectors and disrupted surveillance cameras. Despite these actions, Iran's supreme leader indicated a willingness to renew negotiations with the US under President Masoud Pezeshkian's government.
summary: The UN's nuclear watchdog reports that Iran has increased its stockpile of uranium enriched to near weapons-grade levels, now at 164.7 kilograms up to 60%. Tehran banned experienced nuclear inspectors and disrupted surveillance cameras. Despite these actions, Iran's supreme leader indicated a willingness to renew negotiations with the US under President Masoud Pezeshkian's government.

title: US presidential elections: Will Arlington cemetery incident become Trump's political graveyard?
content: Donald Trump’s visit to Arlington National Cemetery marks a contentious moment, as critics claim he used the anniversary to uplift his election campaign. His team asserts he was invited by families of the deceased soldiers, but cemetery officials advised against politicization. The event has sparked division among military veterans.
summary: Donald Trump’s visit to Arlington National Cemetery marks a contentious moment, as critics claim he used the anniversary to uplift his election campaign. His team asserts he was invited by families of the deceased soldiers, but cemetery officials advised against politicization. The event has sparked division among military veterans.

title: Tulsi Gabbard shares one suggestion that she would give Trump to debate Kamala Harris
content: Former Democrat leader Tulsi Gabbard, who earlier debated Kamala Harris, is now assisting Donald Trump in preparation for their upcoming debate on ABC. Gabbard criticizes Harris’s record, calling her a liar, and says Trump will focus on exposing Harris’s record. The debate will follow earlier CNN rules, including muted microphones, standing format, and no sheets allowed.
summary: Former Democrat leader Tulsi Gabbard, who earlier debated Kamala Harris, is now assisting Donald Trump in preparation for their upcoming debate on ABC. Gabbard criticizes Harris’s record, calling her a liar, and says Trump will focus on exposing Harris’s record. The debate will follow earlier CNN rules, including muted microphones, standing format, and no sheets allowed.

title: 20 migrants try to break in California school bus picking up students
content: Approximately 20 migrants allegedly tried to board a California school bus on Wednesday, leading to immediate action by parents and the bus driver to ensure student safety. The Jamul-Dulzura Union School District reported the incident to multiple authorities, including US Border Patrol and San Diego County Sheriff’s Department. As the investigation continues, Superintendent Bystedt has instructed all bus drivers to bypass stops where migrants are present, emphasizing the district’s commitment to safety.
summary: Approximately 20 migrants allegedly tried to board a California school bus on Wednesday, leading to immediate action by parents and the bus driver to ensure student safety. The Jamul-Dulzura Union School District reported the incident to multiple authorities, including US Border Patrol and San Diego County Sheriff’s Department. As the investigation continues, Superintendent Bystedt has instructed all bus drivers to bypass stops where migrants are present, emphasizing the district’s commitment to safety.

title: Two Hong Kong journalists found guilty of conspiring to publish seditious content
content: Two former editors of the now-closed Hong Kong independent media outlet Stand News, Patrick Lam and Chung Pui-kuen, have been convicted of conspiring to publish seditious materials. The court ruled that 11 of 17 articles promoted illegal ideologies against Hong Kong and Chinese governments. The parent company, Best Pencil Ltd, was also found guilty.
summary: Two former editors of the now-closed Hong Kong independent media outlet Stand News, Patrick Lam and Chung Pui-kuen, have been convicted of conspiring to publish seditious materials. The court ruled that 11 of 17 articles promoted illegal ideologies against Hong Kong and Chinese governments. The parent company, Best Pencil Ltd, was also found guilty.

title: Trump's first reaction ahead of Kamala Harris-CNN interview: 'When they ask her a question...'
content: Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, is set to give her first interview with CNN tonight alongside her running mate Tim Walz. Former President Donald Trump criticized the interview for being taped and edited, and questioned why Harris needs Walz with her. This interview aims to address criticisms against Harris for not engaging with the press recently.
summary: Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, is set to give her first interview with CNN tonight alongside her running mate Tim Walz. Former President Donald Trump criticized the interview for being taped and edited, and questioned why Harris needs Walz with her. This interview aims to address criticisms against Harris for not engaging with the press recently.

title: US presidential elections: Trump&Co sink to new low with ugly sexual slurs against Kamala
content: Former President Donald Trump amplified another sexist slur against Kamala Harris on social media. His followers continue similar attacks amid Harris gaining in battleground state polls. Political pundits note Trump’s misogynistic history is driving away female voters, potentially impacting his election chances. Trump often denies unfavorable poll results.
summary: Former President Donald Trump amplified another sexist slur against Kamala Harris on social media. His followers continue similar attacks amid Harris gaining in battleground state polls. Political pundits note Trump’s misogynistic history is driving away female voters, potentially impacting his election chances. Trump often denies unfavorable poll results.

title: Enraged passenger smashes computers at airport. He was sold fake American Airlines ticket
content: A Haitian man was detained at Santiago's Nuevo Pudahuel Airport in Chile after causing $20,000 worth of damage. He went on a rampage with a hammer when he realized the American Airlines ticket sold to him was fake. The incident was caught on camera and the man went on smashing the computers and screaming. He was later handed over to police after being restrained by airport security.
summary: A Haitian man was detained at Santiago's Nuevo Pudahuel Airport in Chile after causing $20,000 worth of damage. He went on a rampage with a hammer when he realized the American Airlines ticket sold to him was fake. The incident was caught on camera and the man went on smashing the computers and screaming. He was later handed over to police after being restrained by airport security.

title: Is UK planning to ban smoking? Here's what PM Starmer said
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has announced plans for more stringent anti-smoking measures, which could ban smoking in outdoor areas like pubs and restaurants. The Labour government aims to reduce smoking-related deaths and healthcare costs. Additionally, they plan to reintroduce legislation to gradually raise the tobacco purchasing age, potentially making smoking illegal for future generations.
summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has announced plans for more stringent anti-smoking measures, which could ban smoking in outdoor areas like pubs and restaurants. The Labour government aims to reduce smoking-related deaths and healthcare costs. Additionally, they plan to reintroduce legislation to gradually raise the tobacco purchasing age, potentially making smoking illegal for future generations.

title: Police kills man on Piscataqua River Bridge, body of an 8-yr-old found from his car
content: On Thursday morning, police shot dead a man on the I-95 bridge connecting Maine and New Hampshire and then found a body of an eight-year-old in his car. The man was believed to be in the run after killing a woman in Troy, New Hampshire. The bridge is now closed for investigation, with authorities indicating no threat to the public.
summary: On Thursday morning, police shot dead a man on the I-95 bridge connecting Maine and New Hampshire and then found a body of an eight-year-old in his car. The man was believed to be in the run after killing a woman in Troy, New Hampshire. The bridge is now closed for investigation, with authorities indicating no threat to the public.

title: Venezuelan gang takes over a Colorado apartment? Truth behind viral video
content: A chilling video of armed men holding an apartment complex in Colorado hostage has gone viral, preceding a shootout that injured several. Suspected to be the work of the Venezuelan Tren de Aragua mob, the incident has prompted residents to consider relocating. Aurora City Council member Danielle Jurinsky said everyone is helping the migrants but it's the Americans who are trapped in these apartments.
summary: A chilling video of armed men holding an apartment complex in Colorado hostage has gone viral, preceding a shootout that injured several. Suspected to be the work of the Venezuelan Tren de Aragua mob, the incident has prompted residents to consider relocating. Aurora City Council member Danielle Jurinsky said everyone is helping the migrants but it's the Americans who are trapped in these apartments.

title: Canada's 2023 wildfires emit more carbon than Russia and Japan combined: Nasa
content: Scientists from Nasa's Jet Propulsion Laboratory report that Canadian wildfires from May to September 2023 released 640 million metric tons of carbon, surpassing the annual fossil fuel emissions of Russia and Japan in 2022. The fires were fueled by unusually warm and dry conditions, affecting 18 million hectares of forest.
summary: Scientists from Nasa's Jet Propulsion Laboratory report that Canadian wildfires from May to September 2023 released 640 million metric tons of carbon, surpassing the annual fossil fuel emissions of Russia and Japan in 2022. The fires were fueled by unusually warm and dry conditions, affecting 18 million hectares of forest.

title: Trump assassination attempt: FBI releases photos and new evidence, reveals shooter's detailed planning
FAA grounds SpaceX Falcon9 rockets after booster crash; could impact already delayed spacewalk mission
content: SpaceX rocket launches have been suspended after a Falcon 9 booster crash during a landing attempt, causing a fire. Following the incident, the FAA began an investigation and will need to approve corrective actions before resuming flights. The suspension impacts SpaceX's upcoming private and NASA crew missions, and other scheduled launches.
summary: SpaceX rocket launches have been suspended after a Falcon 9 booster crash during a landing attempt, causing a fire. Following the incident, the FAA began an investigation and will need to approve corrective actions before resuming flights. The suspension impacts SpaceX's upcoming private and NASA crew missions, and other scheduled launches.
